title: 104_s1486
content: PLACEMENT PROGRAMS FOR FEDERAL EMPLOYEES AFFECTED BY REDUCTION IN FORCE ACTIONS. The "Public Servant Priority Placement Act of 1995" establishes placement programs for Federal employees affected by reduction in force actions. The Director of the Office of Personnel Management must establish a Government-wide program within 180 days to facilitate employment placement for affected employees. The "Public Servant Priority Placement Act of 1995" establishes agency placement programs for Federal employees affected by reduction in force actions. These programs offer vacant positions within the agency to qualified employees affected by the reduction in force, with specific criteria for the offered positions. The Government-wide placement program coordinates with agency programs for placing employees affected by reduction in force. It requires offering vacant positions within the agency to qualified employees from other agencies. The offered positions must have equal pay to the employee's current or last position and be within the commuting area of their residence or previous position. The Government-wide placement program allows offering vacant positions within an agency to employees affected by reduction in force. The offered positions must match the employee's current or last position in terms of classification or pay, and be within the commuting area. The agency placement program allows offering vacant positions within the commuting area of the employee's residence or last held position. The program does not affect existing priority placement programs within the Department of Defense. Technical amendments include renaming the section heading for the Government-wide list of vacant positions. The table of sections for chapter 33 of title 5, United States Code, is amended by replacing the item related to section 3329 with a new entry. Government-wide list of vacant positions and placement programs for Federal employees affected by reduction in force actions.
